CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: The decyl-substituted PffBB-10 - based device showed a good PCE of 8.22% with a high V oc of 0.93 V , a J sc of 14.62 mA cm^-2 , and a FF of 60.44% when the active layer was coated at 80 ° C. On the other hand , PffBB-10 - based devices fabricated at 60 and 100 °C spin - coating temperatures exhibited inferior photovoltaic performance with a lower J sc and a much lower FF of ∼ 56% except for a similar V oc .

Let's think step by step.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-10 |
| Decyl-substituted PffBB-10 |

Note: "Decyl-substituted PffBB-10" is a single material name, not two separate materials.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

I apologize for the mistake in my previous response. Here are the valid material names mentioned in the paragraph:

| Material Name |
| --- |
| PffBB-10 |

The material name "Decyl-substituted PffBB-10" is not a valid material name as it is not a unique name, but rather a modification of the material PffBB-10.

Therefore, the table above presents the only valid material name mentioned in the paragraph, which is "PffBB-10".

On the other hand , PffBB-10 - based devices fabricated at 60 and 100 °C spin - coating temperatures exhibited inferior photovoltaic performance with a lower J sc and a much lower FF of ∼ 56% except for a similar V oc .

Let's think step by step.

| Property Value |
| --- |
| PCE | 8.22% |
| V oc | 0.93 V |

| FF | 60.44% |
| J sc (60 °C) | ∼ 56% |
| FF (60 °C) | ∼ 56% |

| FF (100 °C) | ∼ 56% |

Note: The "∼" symbol indicates that the value is approximate, and the numbers following it are not exact values but rather rough estimates.
